D3 Mapping

14 Jan 2015

The D3 JavaScript library is an awesome tool to create responsive and interative visualizations. In order to sharpen my own D3 skills and to practice incorporating Makefiles into my workflow, I decided to visualize the aggregate income of the counties in the US using a graduated symbol map (bubble map). Mouse over the bubbles for more information about each bubble.

Recommendation Systems

02 Dec 2014

The accurate item and music recommendations of Amazon.com and Pandora.com respectively, have always astounded me. Each system is unique -- tailored and optimized with different considerations in mind. In order to understand how these recommendation systems work, I decided build my own.

Using the dataset provided by the Yelp Dataset Challenge, I built a basic Recommendation System using collaborative filtering

This recommendation system is an ongoing project that will push me to dive deeper and build more sophisticated recommenders while sharpening my python skills.

Please feel free to take a look at the recommendation system I have built so far here: Recommendation System

Learning D3

01 Nov 2014

Recently, I discovered D3 a powerful Javascript library for creating beautiful and responsive data visualizations.

It works seamlessly with existing web technologies can interact with all parts of the DOM (document object model), and is as flexible as the client side web technology stack.

As a simple example, the chart at the bottom of the page uses spline interpolation with D3's built in axes and time scales to visualize your scrolling and clicking activity during your time on this page.
